questions.text: Kleine-Levin syndrome is characterized by the following except : (*)
Which of the following is not true about somnambulism? (*)
Premature ejaculation is due to defect in: (*)
All are true about narcolepsy except? (*)

options.label: A
options.text: Familial with mutation of anti-gen of class II MHC

questions.text: All are true about "Obsessive-compulsive personality disorder" except?

options.label: A
options.text: The essential feature of the disorder is a pervasive pattern of perfectionism and inflexibility

options.label: B
options.text: Epidemiologically, DSM 5 reports an estimated prevalence ranging from 2 to 8 percent

options.label: C
options.text: It is more common in women than in men.

options.label: D
options.text: Freud hypothesized that the disorder is associated with difficulties in the anal stage of psychosexual development

questions.correct_answer: C. It is more common in women than in men.

questions.text: All of the following are included under medical complications seen in anorexia nervosa except? (**)
Which of the following is seen in NREM II?
Which of the following is the primary defense mechanism in borderline personality disorder?
Which of the following is not true regarding sexual arousal disorder in males?

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of nocturnal penile tumescence rules out medical causes.

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most common sexual disorder in males

options.label: C
options.text: Aetiology can be mixed (i.e. both organic as well as psychogenic factors can be present)

options.label: D
options.text: Primary erectile dysfunction is more common than secondary erectile dysfunction

questions.correct_answer: D. Primary erectile dysfunction is more common than secondary erectile dysfunction

questions.text: A 35 year old man with an obsessive compulsive personality disorder is likely to exhibit all of the following features, except-
What is the treatment of stage 4 sleep disorders or parasomnias?
REM sleep behavioural disorder is mostly seen in association with? (NIMHANS 19)
Which of the following is not true regarding narcolepsy? (JIPMER DEC 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Related gene on 6th chromosome MHC 2 HLA DR 2

options.label: B
options.text: Hyperactivity of orexin releasing neurons in hypothalamus

options.label: C
options.text: Inability of brain to regulate sleep wake cycle

questions.correct_answer: B. Hyperactivity of orexin releasing neurons in hypothalamus

questions.text: A woman reports to her physician that she can achieve orgasm only when recalling a previous, abusive boyfriend. Suspecting the presence of a paraphilia, the physician should explore for further evidence of
What is the term used to describe increased sexual desire in males? (*)
The marked EEG in below rectangular box is of: (*)

A childhood friend makes a visit to your office. The last time you saw her was at her wedding one year ago. As the conversation proceeds, you ask her casually if married life is treating her well. She suddenly bursts into tears and admits that her husband is physically abusive, but that she can't leave him because she is deeply afraid of being alone. Going back to childhood, this woman has always had her parents make decisions for her, including those regarding her education and career. She has always been very pleasant and courteous in her dealings with others, and avoids arguments or disagreements whenever possible. Which of the following personality disorders does this woman most likely suffer from?

A middle-aged, divorced mother brings her 19-year-old daughter in for an evaluation. She says that her daughter has "a serious problem." The woman is concerned because her daughter always keeps to herself, does not date, has no close friends, and refuses to participate in activities popular with women of her age. The daughter is extremely fascinated by witchcraft, spending countless hours in her room gazing into a crystal ball and muttering under her breath. When confronted about her behavior, she says, "I have some supernatural powers that I am not willing to discuss." She attends college regularly and earns good grades. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A young girl with anorexia nervosa is on treatment. Even after taking adequate food according to the recommended diet plan for last 1 week, there is no gain of weight. What is the next step in management? (AIIMS NOV 19)

options.label: B
options.text: Observe the patient for 2 hours after giving meal

options.label: D
options.text: Increase the caloric intake from 1500 kcal to 2000 kcal per day

questions.correct_answer: B. Observe the patient for 2 hours after giving meal

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about anorexia nervosa? (JIPMER MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Anorexia nervosa has the highest mortality amongst all mental disorders

options.label: B
options.text: According to DSM-5, Weight less than 85 percent of expected and BMI < 17.5 are a part of diagnostic criteria

options.label: C
options.text: Acc. to DSM-5, diagnosis is clinical and severity is based on BMI values

options.label: D
options.text: Patient may or may not verbally tell about self-perception of being fat

questions.correct_answer: B. According to DSM-5, Weight less than 85 percent of expected and BMI < 17.5 are a part of diagnostic criteria

questions.text: Which of the following symptoms does not belong to borderline personality disorder?

options.label: B
options.text: Disturbances in and uncertainty about selfimage

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman suffers from anorexia nervosa. Her parents are concerned about her outcome. Which of the following factors indicates a poor prognosis based on the medical literature?
Which of the following is false:

options.label: C
options.text: Cluster C: Obsessive compulsive personality disorder

questions.correct_answer: B. Cluster C: Borderline personality disorder

questions.text: An 18-years-old girl was brought to the psychiatrist with the complaints of excessive exercising and dieting. Which of the following will help in differentiation between anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa?
questions.correct_answer: A. Significantly lesser weight for height

questions.text: A young woman in the mid-20s with abnormally low body weight reports binge eating and purging 5-10 times a week for the last several years. She has intense fear of becoming fat and has a feeling that she is fat despite an objectively low weight. She has also developed amenorrhea. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A medical student comes with normal weight parotid abscess and dental caries. She gets irritated by inquiry of her eating habit, most probable diagnosis:

A female of 23 years of age has come to emergency after suicidal cut of wrist, history of break up with boyfriend, similar history in past of such attempts. There is no history of depression. She behaves very rudely with nurse but when she was attended by handsome male resident doctor, she talked sweetly. Most Probable diagnosis?

A 32-year-old woman has always been extremely neat and particular. Something of a perfectionist, she often stays long after normal working hours to check on the punctuation and spelling of letters that she prepared during the day. She feels that other collegues in office do not take their work seriously and cant do it meticulously. She is most likely having

A young man is often the object of his friends’ jokes because he drops to the floor whenever he is having a good laugh. Which of the following is this man most likely suffering from?

30 year old gentleman has excessive sleep at work attributed to sleep discomfort at night. He also has recent history of falling while partying with friends. What are the other features that can be seen associated with his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Restlessness of the legs before going to bed

options.label: D
options.text: Paralysis with sleep awake junction hallucinations

questions.correct_answer: D. Paralysis with sleep awake junction hallucinations

questions.text: A demanding 35-year-old woman begins psychotherapy stating that she is both desperate and bored. She reports that for the past 5 or 6 years she has experienced periodic anxiety and depression and has made several suicidal gestures. She also reports a variety of impulsive and self-defeating behaviors and sexual promiscuity. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old woman lives alone in a unkempt house, although her family members have tried in vain to move her to a better dwelling. She wears odd and out-of-fashion clothes and rummages in the garbage cans of her neighbours to look for redeemable cans and bottles. She is very suspicious of her neighbours. She was convinced that her neighbours were plotting against her life for a brief time after she was mugged and thrown onto the pavement by a teenager, but now thinks that this is not the case. She believes in the “power of crystals to protect me” and has them strewn haphazardly throughout her house. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 46-year-old man is being monitored in a sleep study laboratory. After he has been asleep for 90 minutes, his EEG shows low-voltage, random fast activity with sawtooth waves. When awakened during this period, the patient reports that he was dreaming. Which of the following sleep stages was this patient in when awakened?
False regarding Type A personality
Ponto-geniculo-occipital spike is characteristic of which of the following sleep stage?
In psychiatry, the electroencephalogram (EEG) can be helpful in the diagnosis of
Most common EEG abnormality?
questions.correct_answer: A. Diffuse slowing of background rhythm

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about bulimia nervosa?

options.label: A
options.text: Invariable weight loss with endocrine disorder

options.label: B
options.text: Occurrence of both binge eating and inappropriate compensatory behaviors at least twice weekly on an average for 3 Months

questions.correct_answer: A. Invariable weight loss with endocrine disorder

questions.text: False regarding anorexia nervosa:

options.label: A
options.text: Psychiatric symptoms such as depression may be associated

options.label: B
options.text: Excessive exercising can be a feature

questions.correct_answer: D. Decreased appetite is a feature
